value: hello deep thinkers I want a muse today
about the darkness and the light good
and evil I really don't know where I'm
gonna go with it but some of the things
that have been going through my head
lately and to be fair by lately I mean
for the last 10 or 15 years are are
related to this relationship between the
darkness and the light and is one
necessary to have the other like we were
so often told and reminded that we
couldn't know joy if we didn't know pain
this this sort of idea free will ties
into it as well why does that figure in
so strongly into religions and
spirituality which is free will I guess
it's all interrelated and I'm just gonna
riff so I'm gonna start with one thought
that occurred to me a really long time
ago and it was I was imagining a hallway
with doors off of it okay so picture
this there's a hallway and there's rooms
off of it and all the doors are closed
and in the rooms off of the hallway the
lights are on but in the hallway there
is no light so if you open one of those
doors the light comes into the hallway
and it makes it brighter what happens in
the room does it get darker what are the
properties of light do they expand to
fill their environment without being
diluted or not and perhaps more
interestingly what are the properties of
darkness
in that hallway does the darkness spread
into the room does the room get darker
because of a lack of light or because of
an intrusion of darkness on the surface
and my guess philosophically speaking is
the darkness can't spread into the light
room if the lightroom does get less
bright it would be because the light is
spread further but I don't know if the
Lightroom actually does get darker I
don't think it does maybe just from
reflective light but not actually darker
but i think the hopeful thing that that
happens in my mind is knowing that
darkness can be relieved by light and
that it doesn't take anything away from
light it's just there in the spaces
where light hasn't gotten to yet but it
can't go into the light and ruin the
light that can't happen it can only
happen the other way around light beats
darkness if we could add it to rock
paper scissors light dark light would
light would come out on top I'm sure
this is an actual measurable thing and
that science could give me an answer if
I would just google it but that wouldn't
be very romantic or philosophical it
wouldn't tickle the funny little corners
of my mind where I like to amuse about
these things without knowing what
scientists say just like the poor
bumblebee could be walking around on the
grass climbing up flower stems to the
blossoms because if science got a hold
of that little guy he'd think he
couldn't fly so I just like to think
about my life puzzle without consulting
the physicists on that one and that
makes me think about the notion of good
and evil eternal battle between good and
evil and social admonishments that that
sort of point to this idea that good
can't fight evil on evils terms or it
becomes evil itself I've always had a
big problem with that I I think a lot
about it in a lot of different ways
because my natural bent really and I've
mentioned this before I'm a fighter I
don't deal well with injustice I am
becoming more graceful about it as I age
but I don't I don't like to see it and a
lot of the times you know there's
there's a lot of creative ways to handle
those situations with sometimes to

representatives of good not good itself
but the representatives of good on earth
which is us humanity we have to do some

the actions not the intention sometimes

free will is all about
I don't think you could have good and
evil without free will but here's what I
mean and that is I don't think you could

there would be anything else except evil
bear with me while I try to explain why
I think this if I can imagine a society
where everyone acted according to pre
written rules and routines all the time
because there was no free will and it

natural seems to imply that there wasn't
